title: A must have for superusers.

title: MUST HAVE, 10/10
comment: Best autostart manager. Not only lets you stop auto starts at boot but unlike most similar apps, this lets you disable the many other triggers that cause unneeded/unwanted apps to start themselves up in the background.  This means more RAM, less battery use- and in the case of some low memory devices I've used, an end to random reboots when 200+ apps are installed and many of them are triggered to start at the same time and would end up crashing the system if this app was not used to disable those triggers.

title: 10 Star
comment: This is a MUST HAVE app for anyone looking to make their phone RUN FASTER, SMOOTHER and SAVE BATTERY LIFE. Yes, I said save battery life. Foeget about "task killers" and battery savers this app prevents other from running in the background while still making it accesable. I'm not a big fan of "buying paid apps" (if you know what I mean) but after trying this one out I definitally HAD TO BUY IT. It is worth its money and if you combine it with a cpu governer YOUR BATTERY LIFE WILL SKYROCKET. Root required.

title: Keeps Crashing

title: Fine-tuned control of apps
comment: This is one of the first apps I install after re-flashing my phones.  The UI makes it easy to identify which apps begin running after which system triggers.  I know that most people use it to reduce bloat and regain some processing and RAM and extend battery life, and it certainly helps with all those things.  Your phone will be faster and hold charge longer without all of the automated app processes that add up over time.  However, its best utility is probably in terms of privacy protection.  Gemini App Manager lets you firewall individual apps, but Autostarts lets you make sure they're not even running without your permission.  You would not believe how many of your apps start invisible background processes to send your data home (nothing nefarious, usually, just aggregate data collection for marketing/ analytics.)  You don't often get to choose itemized permissions to accept when using a Google Play app, so being able to control where and when your data is accessed by controlling processes with Autostarts is probably worth the price for privacy-oriented users.

title: Must-have app for rooted users
comment: If you have rooted your phone and you're not using this app, you're doing it wrong.   Want to prevent an app from running constantly without disabling it altogether? Autostarts can do that. There's definitely the potential to cause issues if you disable the wrong intents, but you can always reverse them whenever it's needed. Sorting by app makes it easy to pick out just what you want, and it picks up on significantly more settings than some of the other applications that aim to manage apps on the Play store (IE: Autoruns).  The only missing feature is the option for a detailed readout on the apk's used for each intent, like the yellow text button featured in Titanium Backup. If it was possible to get more information on the fly then Autostarts would be perfect. Other than that, the amount of control it gives you over apps is extremely helpful and it's a great tool.

Others are just glorified task killers.   This will prevent apps/services from running by disabling the triggers.  So many apps/games are poorly written and run services in the background when they aren't needed and many are coded to reload themselves when killed, rendering Androids own task killer and all third party task killers useless.  Now I can control if/when those services are launched!

title: The Best Boot/Task Manager for Android
comment: I did tons of researching and tried virtually all other Android boot managers that got decent reviews or better...Autostarts easily takes the cake. It is one of the VERY few that actually works and successfully blocks stubborn apps from starting (found that nearly all managers fail in this area). This software is very powerful and can do much more than just manage the boot process, which has significantly increased my phone's performance BTW, and IMHO this is a must-have app for the advanced Android user.

title: Saves precious RAM...
comment: I'm running Android 4.0.3 ICS on a device that only has "official" support for 2.2 FroYo... Every single MB of RAM is crucial!  I use advanced task killer and I was constantly noticing apps that I hadn't ran in days in the running list. And others (ahem Google market/play) were nearly always there.  I couldn't believe the default autoruns when I fired this app up.  Not just at start...but and nearly every everything that happened had between 5-20 programs set to run... often having nothing to do with the "trigger" Did full titanium backup and nandroid, went back and killed nearly all of them. No need to start Google market, gmail, the music player and the photo gallery just because I turned on Bluetooth... Killed every auto run but what was obviously needed for the triggering process... took about 20 mins but I now have not only more RAM at my disposal, there are  waaaay less huge drops in RAM for no apparent reason.  Possibly the best dollar I've ever spent.  Only got it a few hours ago but this app is on short list for 6th star status. MUST HAVE FOR ROOTED DROIDS!

title: Excelent
comment: Just an excelent application. All the memory managers on my phone was uninstalled after i installed this one

title: Fundamental
comment: This app is fundamental. All users should have it, specially rooted users with the power to stop blooming apps from starting up when they shouldn't. Why does the shopping list app open when I turn on the phone? Removed.  Not only that: it doesn't show only what runs when the phone is started, but in EVERY STATE CHANGE. Wi-Fi on/off, user present or not, etc, etc, etc, etc;  Only suggestion I have: please cache the list of applications. Everytime I open the app, it takes minutes to rescan all applications in the system. And even if I quickly alternate to another app and back to Autostarts, then it re-scans everything aaaaallll oooover again! Can't it just scan apps that are new on the list, remove the non-existent ones, and ignore the un-changed ones?  ------------  PT: Aplicativo fundamental para todos os usuários, especialmente os que tem "root", pois podem desabilitar o inicio automático de aplicativos. O Autostarts mostra não apenas o que inicia junto com o aparelho, mas sim tudo que é iniciado quando qualquer  status do aparelho muda: quando o Wi-Fi é ligado/desligado, usuário presente ou não, etc, etc, etc, etc...  Só demora um pouco p ler os detalhes de todos os aplicativos.
